column4: pici: how come mi imap-ssl on port 993 still works? it should be closed with this configuration right
with that rules you pasted you dont have any DROPped ?
I guess not?
Im using the webmin configuration gui. default action drop obox says 'drop'
but it doesnt show in the rules when you check it right? so it is missing the DROP policy or rules
should I add a DROP rule then?
if you want to drop things yeah
I want to drop anythingb that I did not explicitly allow to come in
I have all thes Incoming packets (INPUT) accept rules and then default action: drop
should I also do something fo Forwarded packets (FORWARD) ? there are none yet
well your rule has a hole then if it does allow one to go through..comb it good
what do you make o fthe pastebin? should drop ?
i cant work with an output of iptables -L like that, i like to see the full rules written in iptables
what is the difference between Incoming packets (INPUT) and Forwarded packets (FORWARD)? b/c Forwarded packets (FORWARD) has no rules but a default 'accept'
they are different chains
forwarded packets... mm ok so default accepts is allright then
if thats what you wanted, its acceptable to you?
well I just dont feel the firewall is doing anything.. why is that port 993 open I dont understand
because you dont have a DROP rule
How o I add it? what should it look like?
you have to google for iptables tutorial, the one i like is by gandalf..hang on let me see if I have a link
ok... I should be able to add one generic drop rule that says: If not allowed by any accept rule, then drop?
possibly, no guarantee it will work or no holes on it
